abstract.p: Bernard Goodman letter on Aug 3 article on human-generated power says automobiles in motion represent enormous source of untapped power that is squandered in pounding pacement when some of it could be captured by plates on road surface that would press on mechanisms that turned generators (S)

block.p: Automobiles in motion represent an enormous source of untapped power that is squandered in pounding the pavement when some of it could surely be captured by plates on the road surface that would press on mechanisms that turned generators. People in the cars would feel a very little bump from each small rise, certainly no more than the usual rough spot. Multiply the number of ''hits'' by the sheer volume of automobile traffic to get some idea of what such a mechanism could produce in electrical energy.
